page.title: 03VILLAGE LIFE, WENSLEYDALE
page.content: The three villages we studied are very attractive and most people we interviewed felt that they are good places in which to live. All have village greens which are centres of village activity, especially in the summer. Each village also has its own village hall. In the summer months each village has a Fete with sports, stalls, teas and other attractions. A Committee is formed to organise this event. In winter there are whist and domino drives and some dances in the village halls. There are evening classes and occasional lectures and concerts organised by various groups. In each village there is a Methodist Chapel which has its own activities throughout the year. All the villages come within the Church of England Parish of Aysgarth and share the activities of the Church.
